perturbation.original_text: 7.2 Subject to Article 7.3, for a period of five (5) years after the termination of the related RESEARCH PROJECT, the receiving Party shall not use, except (a) for the benefit of the Parties' collaboration or (b) such use as is expressly allowed by this Agreement and/or disclose any Confidential Information to any third party (i) without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party if the Confidential Information was received from the other Party, or (ii) the prior written consent of both Parties if the Confidential Information was generated during a RESEARCH PROJECT, provided however that CERES shall have no restrictions regarding CERES INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY or regarding any information of material resulting from RESEARCH PROJECT activities in which IGER does not participate. Confidential Information shall only be made accessible to each Party's employees or students on a need-to-know basis and not to any third party, subject to Articles 7.3 and 7.4. Manuscripts and papers published in scientific journals and presentations made at public meetings that include Confidential Information are exempt from the confidentiality obligations of this Article, provided the Parties followed the procedure set forth in Article 8.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.2 Subject to Article 7.3, the receiving Party shall not use, except (a) for the benefit of the Parties' collaboration or (b) such use as is expressly allowed by this Agreement and/or disclose any Confidential Information to any third party (i) without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party if the Confidential Information was received from the other Party, or (ii) the prior written consent of both Parties if the Confidential Information was generated during a RESEARCH PROJECT, provided however that CERES shall have no restrictions regarding CERES INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY or regarding any information of material resulting from RESEARCH PROJECT activities in which IGER does not participate. Confidential Information shall only be made accessible to each Party's employees or students on a need-to-know basis and not to any third party, subject to Articles 7.3 and 7.4. Manuscripts and papers published in scientific journals and presentations made at public meetings that include Confidential Information are exempt from the confidentiality obligations of this Article, provided the Parties followed the procedure set forth in Article 8.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the five-year limitation on confidentiality extends the obligation indefinitely, directly contradicting the original stated duration. This introduces uncertainty about when the confidentiality obligations expire, causing conflict.

perturbation.original_text: 4.12 The provisions of this Article 4 and specifically but without limitation the definitions in Articles 4.1 through 4.4 and Articles 4.6 and 4.7 shall apply to any results obtained in RESEARCH PROJECTS, including results of activities covered by EXISTING AGREEMENTS, except if expressly provided otherwise in a SCHEDULE or in Article 18.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.12 The provisions of this Article 4 and specifically but without limitation the definitions in Articles 4.1 through 4.4 and Articles 4.6 and 4.7 shall not apply to any results obtained in RESEARCH PROJECTS, including results of activities covered by EXISTING AGREEMENTS, even if not expressly provided otherwise in a SCHEDULE or in Article 18.
perturbation.explanation: By negating the applicability of Article 4's provisions (including definitions of intellectual property) to all research project results, including those from existing agreements, even when SCHEDULEs or Article 18 don't specify an exception, the revised text directly contradicts the original. This creates uncertainty about which intellectual property rules apply to which results.

perturbation.original_text: 5.3.1 Subject to Articles 5.1 and 5.2, the Parties acknowledge and agree that CERES shall have the exclusive right, with the right to grant sublicenses to this right, to use and commercially exploit JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY (including but not limited to RELEASED VARIETIES) and OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS for any and all uses and fields, including, but not limited to, use in the COLLABORATION CROPS and crops other than the COLLABORATION CROPS. Any commercialization (including, but not limited to, the grant of commercialization licenses) of JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY and/or OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS shall result in CERES paying IGER a reasonable remuneration (whether as a royalty or in some other form as the Parties may agree) to be negotiated in good faith. The terms for remuneration will be specified, with respect to specific RESEARCH PROJECTS, JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY and/or OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS, either in the respective SCHEDULES or in other agreements to be executed by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3.1 Subject to Articles 5.1 and 5.2, the Parties acknowledge and agree that CERES shall have the right, with the right to grant sublicenses to this right, to use and commercially exploit JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY (including but not limited to RELEASED VARIETIES) and OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS for any and all uses and fields, including, but not limited to, use in the COLLABORATION CROPS and crops other than the COLLABORATION CROPS. Any commercialization (including, but not limited to, the grant of commercialization licenses) of JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY and/or OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS may or may not result in CERES paying IGER remuneration, as CERES deems appropriate. The terms for remuneration will not be specified, with respect to specific RESEARCH PROJECTS, JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY and/or OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS, in the respective SCHEDULES or in other agreements to be executed by the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandated that CERES shall pay IGER reasonable remuneration. The change removes this certainty, making remuneration discretionary ('may or may not'). Furthermore, it states that remuneration terms will not be specified in schedules or other agreements, directly conflicting with the original intention to negotiate and document those terms, thus creating uncertainty about IGER's compensation.
